definitions.definition: Individually ; separately ; used in a sentence with a plural subject to indicate that the action or state described by the verb applies to all members of the described group individually, rather than collectively to the entire group .
examples: We ordered half a chicken each , but we each got a whole one.
You are each right in a different way.
There are three of us and we have five dollars each , so that means we've got 15 dollars.
The apartments each boast central heating .

secondary_definitions: Individually ; separately ; used in a sentence with a plural subject to indicate that the action or state described by the verb applies to all members of the described group individually, rather than collectively to the entire group .
